sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the intersection of (A x B) ∩ (B x A) and (B x A) ∩ (A x B), and verify that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
